item.title: akShaya-tRtIya perversion
item.description:
Source: TW

VaishAkha-shukla-tRtIyA a.k.a #AkshayaTritiya has morphed into a gold acquisition spree in recent years. This is a thread attempting to share some details on AT’s actual traditional practices.

Oldest ref to #AkshayaTritiya is in विष्णुधर्मसूत्र. Emphasis is on the worship of vAsudeva, fasting, oblations of whole grains & donating them. Whatever a man donates on that day becomes inexhaustible.

उपोषितोऽक्षतैर् वासुदेवम् अभ्यर्च्य, तान् एव हुत्वा, दत्त्वा च सर्वपापेभ्यः पूतो भवति।

item.title: gAjan
item.description:
Source: TW

Today is Chaitra Sankranti. Today Bengali hindus in WB, Bangladesh & Tripura celebrates gajan with great fervour. Gajan is related to Shiva, Dharma thakur & Ma manasa - Though Gajan in Chaitra sankranti is related to Shiva. It ends today with Charak puja.

At Malda Gajan is known as Gambhira & at Jalpaiguri it is known as Gomira. Kali Dance is an important part of gajan. Also, Hara-Gauri Nritya, Kalika-Patari nritya, Samshan-nritya are all important part of gajan.

item.title: Onam bali
item.description:
Description of Onam celebrations in his times by Mahakavi Ulloor (6 June 1877 – 15 June 1949)

Until quite recently, it was Vamana-centric.

Source: TW

The association of Oṇam with Bali is a recent (post 17th-century) phenomenon. The celebration on Oṇam that is mentioned in the Maturaikkāñci, the poems of the Tamil Āḻvārs, etc. was in honor of Māyōṉ/Viṣṇu (i.e. Vāmana) and, more specifically, Vāmana’s birth on Śrāvaṇa Dvādaśī under the asterism Śroṇā.

item.title: vAsudeva on sandhyAvandanam
item.description:
Post meant specifically for people born in Brahmana families but not living as Brahmanas:

What happens when you don’t do Sandhyavandana (while doing everything else under the sun such as charity, temple visits, meditation/ maintaining a “pure, good” heart or doing good things, attending spiritual discourses or tours, reading spiritual books, performing ancestral/Pitru worship)?

If you recite even a simple Achamana mantra thereafter, it won’t have any effect.

If you do Pitrutarpana, your mantras will have no effect. Your pitrus will starve and curse you ensuring that you will get similar pain. Tamil Brahmin community people have this habit of doing pitrukaarya but won’t do Sandhyavandana. You are basically doing this to your pitrus. And don’t worry - their curses will ensure that similar pain will hit you. Enjoy then.
